item.title: Help making an item members only please
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

You can edit either the equipping packet (packet 41), or the wear boolean where the packet is used.

Use an if statement.

And yes, a switch statement would make that much cleaner.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @iceman327 iceman327
item.description:
@iceman327 wrote:

Well I’ve got this:

I guess ours are the same just in a different style.

So just add them inside this??

public int GetCLMembers(int ItemID) { if (ItemID == -1) { return 0; } //String ItemName = GetItemName(ItemID); //enable this if you would like to make items members using their name. if (ItemID == 6918) { return 1; } if (ItemID == 6916) { return 1; } if (ItemID == 6924) { return 1; } if (ItemID == 14915) { return 1; } if (ItemID == 6920) { return 1; } if (ItemID == 6922) { return 1; } if (ItemID == 6585) { return 1; } if (ItemID == 4214) { return 1; } if (ItemID == 1040) { return 1; } if (ItemID == 1042) { return 1; } if (ItemID == 1044) { return 1; } if (ItemID == 1046) { return 1; } if (ItemID == 1048) { return 1; } if (ItemID == 6528) { return 1; } if (ItemID == 7158) { return 1; } if (ItemID == 1149) { return 1; } if (ItemID == 3140) { return 1; } if (ItemID == 4087) { return 1; } if (ItemID == 4585) { return 1; } if (ItemID == 1187) { return 1; } if (ItemID == 11281) { return 1; } if (ItemID == 11298) { return 1; } if (ItemID == 11981) { return 1; } if (ItemID == 11977) { return 1; } if (ItemID == 11978) { return 1; } if (ItemID == 11979) { return 1; } if (ItemID == 11824) { return 1; } if (ItemID == 11153) { return 1; } if (ItemID == 11154) { return 1; } if (ItemID == 11155) { return 1; } if (ItemID == 11490) { return 1; } if (ItemID == 11444) { return 1; } if (ItemID == 11371) { return 1; } if (ItemID == 11372) { return 1; } if (ItemID == 11168) { return 1; } if (ItemID == 11169) { return 1; } if (ItemID == 11170) { return 1; } return 0; }

item.title: Help making an item members only please
item.dc:creator: @iceman327 iceman327
item.description:
@iceman327 wrote:

Yeah I have that
but…
HOW I DO IT?!?!?!?

I got this:

if (CLMembers > playerIsMember) {
sendMessage(“You need to be a Member to equip this item.”);
GoFalse = true;
}
if (GoFalse == true) {
return false;
}
int wearAmount = playerItemsN[slot];
if (wearAmount < 1) {
return false;
}

Do i just post the thing I was gonna in public boolean process right underneath this poo??

Read full topic

no no no no

item.title: Help making an item members only please
item.dc:creator: @iceman327 iceman327
item.description:
@iceman327 wrote:

Well this was the first thing that I thought of, but I’m not sure if I put it in the right place.
It compiled correctly and everything but did not work when I asked a normal player to test it.

if(playerIsMember == 0) { if((playerEquipment[playerCape] == 14089)) { remove(playerEquipment[playerCape], playerCape); sendMessage("You need to be a member to wear this."); } }

Should I add this in my public boolean process(){

???

Read full topic
